did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Newspapers, clippings, illustrations. Some photocopies. Focus is on the period of time leading up to the Civil War, slavery and anti-slavery, and Reconstruction. Some articles are about the opening of the Prudence Crandall Museum. Copies of Prudence Crandall's obituaries from various newspapers. Rare illustrations from the time of the Civil War and Reconstruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Random sample of articles from the Newspaper Collection are as follows:
"Admitting Black children into school in Nantucket", Salem Register, Salem, Massachusetts. vol XLIV, March 7, 1844. (folder 4, pc78.03.01)
"Presidential rejoicing over the outrage in Kansas", The Liberator, Boston, Mass., vol. XXV no. 19, William Lloyd Garrison, ed. May 11, 1855. (folder 5, pc72.01.02)
"State acquires Crandall House used as early school for Black girls." The Hartford Times, August, 24, 1969. (clipping) (folder 9)
"Speech of Edmund Perkins, at Norwich, on Tuesday evening, March 29th, 1859", clipping, phonograhically reported for the Courier by J M W Yerrington of Boston. (folder 10. pc2014.35)
"Our colored troops - the line officers of the First Louisiana Native Guards- sketched by our special artist" illustration, Harper's Weekly Feb 28, 1863.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Newspapers are arranged in folders grouped in three archival boxes. Newspapers, clippings, and illustrations can be found by collection number in the museum collection database. Newspaper collection boxes are stored in Museum Collections Storage.
